title: Add more data resources to Meltano handbook
Mission Statement
description:
Goals:

* Update Mission statement to have a clear mission
* Center Data Professionals 
* Create an ambitious goal and vision that we can grow Meltano into

Proposing this because I was thinking over the weekend about our "Why". Why are we building Meltano in this way and what's our vision? Hopefully this clarifies it a bit and makes it even more exciting :smile:

title: Update the ELT runner to explicitly log any error messages
description:
## Update ELT runner error handling

  - This relates to issue #2451 By explicitly logging any errors from an ELT run, it ensures that the error message is passed to the Meltano UI (specifically the log modal window during a pipeline run)

  - Another side benefit of logging the error this way is that the error is prepended by the `meltano |` string, which makes the formatting more consistent.

title: Resolve "Allow plugins to inherit configuration from others"
description:
## Merge Request Checklist

  - [x] Link to an issue
  - [x] Include the proposed fix or feature
    - [x] Refactor plugins around inheritance
      - [x] Misc: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1971
      - [x] Plugins: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1972
    - [x] Implement `inherit_from`
    - [x] Add `--inherit-from` flag to `meltano add` (and `--as`?)
    - [x] Meltano UI: Configure existing inherited plugins
    - [x] Set `ProjectPlugin.parent` lazily in `ProjectPluginsService` to improve performance
    - [x] Raise special error when `--inherit-from` on `meltano add` or `inherit_from` in `meltano.yml` doesn't exist
    - [ ] Optional
      - [ ] Add `meltano list` to list "inherits from" relations
      - [ ] Only install plugins once per `pip_url`
      - [ ] Meltano UI: Show inherited settings differently
      - [ ] Meltano UI: Add the same discoverable plugin multiple times using inheritance
      - [ ] Meltano UI: Add a new plugin by inheriting from an existing one
      - [ ] Have `meltano add` suggest adding `--custom` when plugin was not known
  - [x] Include and update tests for the modified code
    - [x] Make existing tests pass
    - [x] Write tests for new functionality
      - [x] Let ProjectPlugin inherit from another ProjectPlugin or BasePlugin with a different name
      - [x] Let plugin inherit configuration of parent plugin
      - [x] Don't read settings from custom env vars when plugin name doesn't match parent
      - [x] Use ProjectPluginsService.get_parent in ProjectAddService.add for consistency
      - [x] Add `meltano add` --inherit-from and --as options
  - [ ] Include a documentation change: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/1984

> Once your merge request is complete, please assign it a Meltano maintainer for review cycle. Once the review cycle finished, the reviewer shall approve the merge request so it can be merged by any Meltano maintainer.

> Once your merge request is complete, please assign it a Meltano maintainer for review cycle. Once the review cycle finished, the reviewer shall approve the merge request so it can be merged by any Meltano maintainer.

Closes #2111 

@DouweM I implemented the core functionality & testing for this issue but would appreciate your guidance on these things:

- What is the expected behavior for CLI setting config when it's already set via `<ENV>_FILE` inside the `DotEnv` store?

- Where should docs for the feature go? Maybe this MR should wait until the configuration doc page (#2250) is created, then also add a reference specifically to Docker secrets under docs/production > managing configuration > containerized?

I did my best to stick with conventions, please excuse any oversights :sweat_smile: 

```bash
(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$ cat .env
TAP_CSV_FILES_DEFINITION_FILE=/tmp/whatever
TAP_CSV_FILES_DEFINITION=value_set_in_dotenv
(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$ echo -n "value_set_in_env_file" > /tmp/whatever
(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$ cat /tmp/whatever
value_set_in_env_file(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$ meltano config tap-csv list
csv_files_definition [env: TAP_CSV_FILES_DEFINITION] current value: 'value_set_in_env_file' (from `.env`)

To learn more about extractor 'tap-csv' and its settings, visit https://meltano.com/plugins/extractors/csv.html
(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$ meltano config tap-csv set csv_files_definition new_config_value
Extractor 'tap-csv' setting 'csv_files_definition' was set in `.env`: 'new_config_value'
(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$ meltano config tap-csv list
csv_files_definition [env: TAP_CSV_FILES_DEFINITION] current value: 'value_set_in_env_file' (from `.env`)

To learn more about extractor 'tap-csv' and its settings, visit https://meltano.com/plugins/extractors/csv.html
(meltano-development-v1) zack@home:$(PWD)/test-project$
```

title: WIP: Allow system database schema to be overridden when PostgreSQL is used
description:
## Merge Request Checklist

  - [x] Link to an issue
  - [ ] Include the proposed fix or feature
  - [ ] Include and update tests for the modified code
  - [ ] Include a documentation change
  - [ ] Add a [CHANGELOG.md](https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/blob/master/README.md#Changelog) entry in the Unreleased section

> Once your merge request is complete, please assign it a Meltano maintainer for review cycle. Once the review cycle finished, the reviewer shall approve the merge request so it can be merged by any Meltano maintainer.

Closes #2082 

I thought I'd take a stab at this one thinking it would be easy, but there's a few gotchas here. What I've committed so far is a conversation starter, it doesn't work yet.

Some problems with this solution:

- The env var is hard coded and spread around a few places. Ideally this setting would be configured like everything else, but there's kind of a circular dependency between the config code and the database
- `core/db.py` supports a database engine per project, but I'm not really sure under what situations there would be more than one project. SQLAlchemy seems to set the schema either on the the tables themselves or via `MetaData`, in either case these would be shared across multiple projects. I'm not sure if that's a concern or not
- Getting the migrations to find out about the configuration option has been a lot harder than I expected. It doesn't seem to recognize the option from `MetaData`. Some sources online suggested using:

```python
    def upgrade(self, silent=False):
        conn = self.engine.connect().execution_options(
            schema_translate_map={
                None: os.getenv('MELTANO_DATABASE_SCHEMA')
            }
        )
```

This seems to change the schema for Alembic, but it causes a database error when the migrations are run:

```
[2020-07-27 18:42:59,321] [21398|MainThread|root] [ERROR] (psycopg2.errors.UndefinedObject) type "job_state" does not exist
LINE 5:  state job_state, 
               ^
 [SQL: '\nCREATE TABLE meltano.job (\n\tid SERIAL NOT NULL, \n\tjob_id VARCHAR, \n\tstate job_state, \n\tstarted_at TIMESTAMP WITHOUT TIME ZONE, \n\tended_at TIMESTAMP WITHOUT TIME ZONE, \n\tpayload VARCHAR, \n\tpayload_flags INTEGER, \n\tPRIMARY KEY (id)\n)\n\n'] (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/f405)
```

With a little direction I'd still be willing to contribute. Otherwise I can leave this as context for a future implementer.

title: Add `url` config option to `target-postgres`
description:
## Merge Request Checklist

  - [x] Link to an issue
  - [x] Include the proposed fix or feature
  - [ ] Include and update tests for the modified code
  - [x] Include a documentation change
  - [x] Add a [CHANGELOG.md](https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/blob/master/README.md#Changelog) entry in the Unreleased section

> Once your merge request is complete, please assign it a Meltano maintainer for review cycle. Once the review cycle finished, the reviewer shall approve the merge request so it can be merged by any Meltano maintainer.

As noted in #2081 the `target-postgres` loader requires separate `PG_DATABASE`, `PG_ADDRESS`, etc. environment variables, which is a bit of a pain. This, along with https://github.com/meltano/target-postgres/pull/4 , allows a `url` config option instead.

In that PR, I added support for a postgres connection url for `target-postgres`. This MR adds that config option to `discovery.yml`.


~~BTW It seems like config options set in `meltano.yml` are ignored unless their value is defined in `discovery.yml`? Is this expected behavior?~~ Edit: nevermind, it's working now. Must have been doing something wrong.

Closes https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2081

title: Resolve "Authentication for Meltano Analyze"
description:
## Merge Request Checklist

  - [x] Link to an issue
  - [x] Include the proposed fix or feature
  - [x] Include and update tests for the modified code
  - [ ] Include a documentation change
  - [x] Add a [CHANGELOG.md](https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/blob/master/README.md#Changelog) entry in the Unreleased section

> Once your merge request is complete, please assign it a Meltano maintainer for review cycle. Once the review cycle finished, the reviewer shall approve the merge request so it can be merged by any Meltano maintainer.

Closes #1

This MR adds authentication to the Meltano UI using `flask-security` and `flask-authlib`.

To enable authentication, you must run `meltano ui` using the `FLASK_ENV=production`.
When run in `development`, authentication will be disabled.

If you want to enable OAuth2 (OpenID Connect) on GitLab.com, you can set the following environment variables in your *.env*.

> Note: the real values can be found in the Meltano 1Password Vault.

*.env*
```bash
OAUTH_GITLAB_APPLICATION_ID=1234567890123456789
OAUTH_GITLAB_SECRET=onetwothreefourfivesix
```

This MR also adds the first tests to the Meltano API.

## References

  - Flask-Security: https://pythonhosted.org/Flask-Security/ (we are using our fork, at https://github.com/meltano/flask-security)  
  - Flask-Authlib: https://docs.authlib.org/en/latest/index.html
